<OLD>
The hi-tech seeker continued to walk toward Trelos his weapon drawn. =
=E2=80=9CStand
down Predacon.=E2=80=9D He said, obviously he was a drone. H=
is weapon was set on
stun as he began to circle the canine warily, being ca=
utious of the
creature=E2=80=99s rather large jaws. =E2=80=9CStand down or =
be fired upon. This is your
last warning.=E2=80=9D

The other two Seeker dr=
ones went after the Mecha lion, who like Trelos was
backing up and showing =
fangs, a deep rumbling roar/growl coming from his
chest.

The two approache=
d, spreading out to flank the lion on either side, their
weapons also drawn=
. =E2=80=9CStand down soldier.=E2=80=9D One of the units said. =E2=80=9CThi=
s is
your only warning.=E2=80=9D The other unit said, both of their weapons=
 set on stun.

With a defiant roar the lion leaped at one of them, a mighty=
 claw catching
one of them across the jaw and sending him spinning to the g=
round with
massive injuries. The other unit of course fired at the lion att=
empting to
subdue him.

With an amazing display of agility the lion dodged =
the first blast and
turned to look at the drone as he displayed his sharp t=
eeth and roared
again, this time the decibel count sharply higher as the de=
bris around them
shook!

*<NEW>*

Ignoring the warning, Trelos leapt at the=
 drone, aiming for anything he
could get his jaws on.

<OLD>
At the moment =
the scans were showing only the conflict that was transpiring.
 All IFF sig=
natures confirmed that these three were definitely Predacon,
some sort of s=
ecurity, and judging from power levels most probrably drones.

*<NEW>*

"Pr=
edecon security drones..." said Salveo, looking up from the monitor.

"It's=
 probably too much to hope that they're policing their own," said Lord
Pers=
eus. "Let's keep the team on standby, I don't want to get into any
unnecess=
ary fights.  Especially where that dog-bot is concerned."

"Right," replied=
 Salveo, going looking back to the screen.

*Meanwhile....*

"We're still o=
n standby!?!?" shouted Ravenchief.

"Shut up, you wouldn't want to be out t=
here anyway." replied Guardia.

Guardia, Ravenchief, Depthcharge and two ot=
her maximal troopers stood at the
door to the base. As team leader, Guardia=
 stood by the comm panel, waiting
for orders.

"The action was just getting=
 good over there.  I was hoping for a good
firefight."

"You were the one t=
hat suggested we pull out," said Depthcharge. "That was a
wise move."

"Arr=
rggg.  Why do I have to be so responsible!  I hate not knowing what's
happe=
ning!" said Ravenchief.

"Don't worry Ravenchief, no one has ever accused y=
ou of being responsible,"
teased Guardia.
